author: Chris Perez
title: De Blasio is open to ‘Fearless Girl’ statue staying on Wall Street | New York Post
text:
Mayor de Blasio is apparently a fan of the “Fearless Girl” statue. 
Hizzoner said Tuesday that he is open to letting the art piece stay in lower Manhattan for the foreseeable future.
“In terms of a longer presence, I’m open to that and we’re going to be looking at that,” de Blasio explained at a press conference.

Lawmakers and activists gathered... “I understand for a lot of people it’s a fantastically powerful symbol and certainly for a lot of women, a lot of girls as well. So, we’re going to see what we can do to prolong the presence.”
The 50-inch-tall bronze statue — which sits strategically in the Financial District, in front of Wall Street’s iconic “Charging Bull” as a symbol of gender equality — has sparked both praise and outrage since being installed by an asset-management company earlier this month.
Local lawmakers and activists, including Public Advocate Letitia James, have urged city officials to extend it’s April 2 permit deadline and keep the “Fearless Girl” as a permanent installation. 
But “Charging Bull” artist Arturo Di Modica wants the piece gone — arguing that it’s nothing but a publicity stunt.
“We’re certainly going to look at the potential of prolonging the Fearless Girl’s presence [in Wall Street],” de Blasio said. “We’re hesitant to do anything permanent because, you know, that has ramifications for the whole city.”
